K sub b equals the fraction, the molar concentration of H B with a positive 1 charge, times the molar concentration of O H with a negative 1 charge, over the molar concentration of B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>HB</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>[HB</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mtext>][OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[B]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above provides the chemical structures for weak bases and their ionization constants, <math alttext="K sub b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the data, which of the following provides the best reason for the trend in base strengths?

choices.label: The different electronegativities of <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="B r " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: The different electronegativities of <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="B r " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.6: Molecular Structure of Acids and Bases

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
